title: Mansion Global Daily: Relisting Luxury, Sydney Suburbs Expect Selling Surge and More
text:
Proceed With Caution When Relisting Your Luxury Home For a Higher Price

Does a truly exceptional property warrant a big price bump in a soft market? Maybe, if the conditions are right. Read More

BY THE NUMBERS

TRENDING TODAY

LISTING OF THE DAY

Steeped in History and Culture, a Magnificent Hacienda in Mexico City

The property was formerly an art school, and it still offers an opportunity for income. Read More

NEIGHBORHOOD NOTES

Grosse Pointe Farms: An Old-Timey Small Town in Detroit

The area offers a real sense of community, along with access to a lake, country clubs and more amenities. Read More

NEWS BITES

Sydney, Australia, Suburbs Expect Selling Surge After experiencing a record-breaking listing shortage, homeowners in Sydney’s eastern suburbs, western suburbs and northern beaches were found to be the most likely to list their homes within the next six months, according to Westpac and Insight Data Solutions. Sydney’s listing numbers dropped 21% year-over-year, according to CoreLogic. Realestate.com.au

U.S. Housing Starts Drop 9% in September The decline in multi-family housing starts in the U.S. is to blame for total housing starts dropping by 9.4% in September from the month prior to 1.26 million units, according to the U.S. Housing and Urban Development Commerce Department. Single-family housing starts, however, increased by 0.3% in September to reach 918,000 units. World Property Journal

Hong Kong Residents Sell Homes At Huge Price Cuts In Order To Emigrate Since the anti-government protests began in Hong Kong four months ago, emigration inquiries have increased 14-fold with many residents selling their property below market value before the housing market worsens, according to Midland Immigration Consultancy. One homeowner in Tuen Mun sold his property for 25% below market value in order to afford his emigration application. South China Morning Post

Eye-Catching Modernist Townhouse Relists in Manhattan for $19.5M Amid a sea of red brick townhouses on Manhattan’s Upper East Side, the Raymond C. and Mildred Kramer house stands out for its modernist white-stucco and glass-brick exterior. One of only a few designed by modernist master William Lescaze, the house is back on the market for $19.5 million, a slight reduction from its $20 million asking price two years ago. Curbed New York

AROUND NEWS CORP

A $49.5 Million Neoclassical Home Gets Decked Out in Neon [The Wall Street Journal]

SoHo Pad Once Occupied by Theater Legend's Son Lists for $5M [New York Post]

description: Mansion Global’s daily round-up of the latest luxury real estate news from around the world
